author: Sayantan Roy
title: Frances Tiafoe Hilariously Claps Back at Girlfriend Ayan Broomfield for Roasting His Flaws During Their Golfing Session
description: Ever wonder why so many tennis players are into golf? It seems like it’s their go-to downtime activity. Probably because both sports are all about focus, strategy, and picking the right shot. Plus, let’s be honest, golf is a little less physically brutal than tennis. Frances Tiafoe even calls tennis the “hardest sport in the […]The post Frances Tiafoe Hilariously Claps Back at Girlfriend Ayan Broomfield for Roasting His Flaws During Their Golfing Session appeared first on EssentiallySports.
content: Modified Feb 20, 2025 | 4:06 AM EST via Imago Image Credits: Imago via Imago Image Credits: Imago Ever wonder why so many tennis players are into golf? It seems like it’s their go-to downtime activity. Probably because both sports are all about focus, strategy, and picking the right shot. Plus, let’s be honest, golf is a little less physically brutal than tennis. Frances Tiafoe even calls tennis the “hardest sport in the world,” so it makes sense he’d want to chill out on the golf course sometimes. He was even spotted golfing with his girlfriend, Ayan Broomfield, recently. We know Tiafoe’s a tennis whiz, but the big question is: how’s his golf game? Frances Tiafoe’s love for basketball is well known. Lots of pro basketball players come to his matches, and he even played in the celebrity game at last year’s NBA All-Star weekend. The Washington Wizards thought so highly of him that they even gave out his bobblehead at one of their games. But golf? Well, this weekend, his long-time girlfriend, Ayan Broomfield, shared a reel on her Instagram account. In that video clip, Tiafoe was spotted giving a ride to Broomfield on a golf cart. Later on, both of them tried a few big swings on the lush green grass and Broomfield captioned that post with, “so, we suck ... but a Sunday afternoon well spent 🫶🏽.“ ADVERTISEMENT Article continues below this ad After seeing this post, Frances Tiafoe shared that post on his social media with a cheeky caption: “Why you lying to the world and only posting my bad shots im him at golf 😂😂😂 @ayan.broomfield.” Perhaps, the American tennis star was a little embarrassed with his poor shot selections that were put on display in that video clip. A post shared by ayan broomfield (@ayan.broomfield) If we take a closer look at the craze for golf in the tennis world, Rafael Nadal is the first name that comes to attention. Do you know Rafael Nadal has competed in the Balearic Mid–Amateur Championship three times in the last four years, winning the 2024 editing? Even Norwegian star Casper Ruud once said, “Sometimes I dream that I could play in a tournament on the PGA Tour or European tour.” Meanwhile, the Australian tennis star, Alex de Mianaur, describes himself as an “Instagram golfer.” Well, for Tiafoe, this wasn’t the only time. In March last year, he shared a similar post where he was seen trying hands at golf. He had then shared a post on his IG stories with the caption, “I’m him, PERIOD.” Context? Renowned American rapper Kevin Gates popularized this term in 2019 when he released an album titled, “I’m him.” At that time, we saw NBA stars, including LeBron James and a few others, making his phrase a trend. This phrase is normally used to depict a dominant figure from a certain field but Tiafoe has perhaps used this to mock his golfing skills. Tiafoe claims he's 'him' at golf—do you think he can master the greens like the court? Debate Not only Tiafoe though, even his girlfriend is often seen trying her hands at this sport. In October 2024, Broomfield gave Frances Tiafoe a virtual tour of her progress on the golf course. She shared a glimpse of her big swing on a Facetime call, while Tiafoe was busy having a haircut at a barbershop. Frances Tiafoe and Ayan Broomfield have been together since 2015, and they’ve definitely become one of tennis’s favorite couples! Is it just the love for the sport which has brought them closer? Well, sports helped them meet each other, but mutual love and support brought them closer in the last few years. In a previous interview, Ayan Broomfield revealed, “We both played junior tennis at a very high level. I’m from Canada, so I was playing for my country, Frances was playing for the States.“ She further added, “And then one of our mutual friends was like, ‘Well, you guys actually would be really good friends.’ So we started talking then and became best friends for a bit. It’s been eight, nine years now. It’s been a journey.” So, that’s how it all began! ADVERTISEMENT Article continues below this ad On Valentine’s Day this year, Ayan Broomfield dropped a romantic 3-word message on Frances Tiafoe’s post which captioned, “Happy v day to my day one. I love you baby and I’m sooo thankful for you everyday damn day. My rock, my everything @ayan.broomfield ❤️❤️.” And the way they support each other through thick and thin is insane! In 2023, when Frances Tiafoe had made it to the Top 10 for the first time in the men’s singles ranking, Broomfield’s heartfelt note to her boyfriend said, “You’ve rocked with me thru it all. The good the bad and the standstills. It’s been a ride no one can put into words. You mean more to me than you can ever imagine. I love you with all I got.” Now, since the 27-year-old Canadian has put tennis on the backseat, what are her goals for the near future? Well, in reply to this question in a previous interview, she highlighted, “Right now, the goal is to get Frances to be a Grand Slam champion. So right now, obviously I have stuff on the side that I’m doing that’s for me personally so that I feel self-fulfilled, but at the end of the day, that’s the goal that we’ve kind of sat down and thought about. That’s what we’re going to go after.” ADVERTISEMENT Article continues below this ad Do you think with the support of his girlfriend and his fans, Tiafoe can finally manage to change his fortunes in 2025? Let the world know your perspective. Debate ADVERTISEMENT Debate Tiafoe claims he's 'him' at golf—do you think he can master the greens like the court? author: Pranchal Srivastava
title: Most ODI matches for India among active players, Ft. Ravindra Jadeja
description: Ravindra Jadeja is playing his 200th ODI match for India which puts him third in the list of most ODI matches for IndiaThe post Most ODI matches for India among active players, Ft. Ravindra Jadeja appeared first on Inside Sport India.
content: Team India’s veteran all-rounder, Ravindra Jadeja, completed a milestone in the ongoing IND vs BAN Champions Trophy match being played at the Dubai International Stadium. To note, Ravindra Jadeja is playing his 200th ODI match, which puts him in third place for most ODI matches for India among active players. Check out the list below. Speaking about the list, Virat Kohli tops the charts with 298 ODI matches. Team India skipper, Rohit Sharma comes next on the list of most ODI matches for India with 269 games. As stated above, Jadeja comes third on the list with 200 matches. Sachin Tendulkar holds the record for the most ODI matches played for India, with 463 appearances from 1989 to 2012. Following him is MS Dhoni, who played 347 ODIs between 2004 and 20191. Rahul Dravid is third on the list with 340 matches from 1996 to 2011. Other notable players include Mohammad Azharuddin (334 matches), Sourav Ganguly (308 matches), and Yuvraj Singh (301 matches). title: Justice Minister: Constitution draft to be ready before elections
description: Srbuhi Galyan announces the new constitution draft will be ready before upcoming elections, focusing on text formation without altering the governance system.
content: Justice Minister Srbuhi Galyan has stated that the development of the new constitution does not envisage changes to the governance system. According to her, the current efforts are concentrated on forming a new text for the constitution rather than introducing a new concept. "We must ensure that the new draft text of the constitution is ready before the upcoming elections," she said, as reported by Radar.am . She added that after the draft is prepared, the issue of putting it to a referendum will be decided. Galyan also emphasized that she will not comment on the content of the constitution's text. "That will be reserved for the appropriate commission," she noted. The minister mentioned that certain clarifications regarding the electoral system are possible, focusing on a proportional representation system and excluding majoritarian elements. "This implies not only constitutional changes but also amendments to the National Assembly's regulations," she stated. Prime Minister Nikol Pashinyan, presenting the provisions of the "Real Armenia" ideology, has stated that adopting a new constitution through a nationwide referendum is essential. The Prime Minister emphasized that “adopting a new constitution via a nationwide referendum is important, as there is a significant lack of legitimacy concerning previous referendums in terms of public perception.”

author: Dolores Quintana
title: Film Review: The Monkey
description: By Dolores Quintana Writer and director Osgood Perkins’ follow-up to his acclaimed 2024 film Longlegs is another animal entirely. The...The post Film Review: The Monkey  appeared first on WestsideToday.
content: By Dolores Quintana Writer and director Osgood Perkins’ follow-up to his acclaimed 2024 film Longlegs is another animal entirely. The Monkey is gob-stoppingly hilarious to behold and filled with existential thoughts about life and death. Even though The Monkey is brimming with bloody carnage and festive annihilation, it struck me as a very personal film. One that grapples with life’s basic unfairness and everyday terror that we all sublimate to survive. How does one deal with death, especially when it claims everyone you love? How does one live? Poor Chip. It is a film-length expansion of the already scary short story by Stephen King that had the same name. I have to be honest and say that the short story actually scared me pretty badly when I read it much too early as a young child, but the thing that always stuck with me was the paperback cover illustration of that damned monkey. While the film does explore the existential dread that comes with living, it is truly more of a comedy with exceptionally gruesome gore. However, Perkins, a master of tone, has managed to make the deeply unsettling and horrendously creative deaths float lightly on the screen rather than be weighted down with sturm and drang. You may never see so many deaths enacted before your eyes seem quite so, er, life-affirming? Yes, it is life-affirming. The film stars an admirable cast, including Theo James in a dual role, Tatiana Maslany, Christian Convery, Colin O’Brien, Rohan Campbell, Sarah Levy, Adam Scott, and Elijah Wood. All of the actors work beautifully well while waiting for their assorted fates. I don’t want to spoil the deaths, but the actors make sure that they remain memorable, even with the smallest amounts of screen time, so that you, the audience member, feel their absence. Even when characters fundamentally misunderstand why a character is gone, there’s a whisper of the real reason that is just out of reach, almost tangible, tantalizingly held over their heads. Perkins is a gifted director on more than one level, probably because he is an actor himself and has cast actors capable of these subtleties and the work of comedy. One character has a moment of such roaring courage that you feel a pang for what might have been had other characters had the benefit of his presence. It also comes into play later when the actions of another character echo the first character. The Monkey’s ritual is exceedingly well played. The lifting of the arm, the crack of the smile, and the animatronic artificiality are frightful but fascinating. You want to see The Monkey play its instrument, even while you gasp when it finally does. That is the see-saw of attraction and repulsion that lies at the center of The Monkey itself. You don’t want to feel its wrath, but don’t you just want to see it perform in some sick and secret way? People talk about “survivors’ guilt,” but no one ever talks about survivors’ relief. Maybe it is the same thing, cast as a more palatable idea, but aren’t you always a little relieved when it’s not your time? The synopsis is delivered on screen in the most matter-of-fact ways: “The monkey that likes killing our family is back.” But what Perkins has done that raises this film above many other King adaptations is that he has rooted it in mundane yet relatable reality. It is one of the most vicious sibling rivalries in film, and the comedic pain of being the kid who gets picked on constantly, no matter what he does, adds another dimension to farcical proceedings. That’s not fun, but Perkins makes it fun. Let the good times roll. But that is the core of the film. Life is what it is, and none of us can ever change our eventual fates no matter what we do, but what we do does matter. We never ask for what life chooses to dump on our heads, but how we manage the horror, with grace and humor or with anger and violence, makes us who we are, and since we are all interconnected, it shapes the fate of us all. How many hateful and vindictive people make others miserable, and what can the world be like when someone finds the strength to act out of love rather than fear? author: Ansh Athani
title: Iman-ul-Haq replaces Fakhar Zaman in Champions Trophy squad before India vs Pakistan match
description: Imam-ul-Haq last played an ODI on October 23 and scored a 98 for Pakistan Shaheens against South Africa in the ICC Champions Trophy warm-ups.The post Iman-ul-Haq replaces Fakhar Zaman in Champions Trophy squad before India vs Pakistan match appeared first on Inside Sport India.
content: It’s been confirmed, Fakhar Zaman has been ruled out of the ICC Champions Trophy. The opener injured his back while fielding in the tournament opener and left the ground for the entire first innings. He returned to bat but was clearly hampered and lasted just 41 balls. “Fakhar Zaman has been deemed unfit for the rest of Pakistan’s Champions Trophy campaign. He sustained a knee injury during last night’s match. The scans following his injury aren’t promising, and he has been ruled out,” the Pakistan Cricket Board (PCB) said in a release. The PCB has also confirmed that Imam-ul-Haq will replace Zaman in Pakistan’s squad for the ICC Champions Trophy. For the uninformed, Pakistan has now lost two openers to injury. Saim Ayub was ruled out a few days before the tournament, having failed to recover from an ankle injury sustained in early January in Cape Town. One can say that instead of making Babar Azam an opener, PCB should have brought in Imam. He averaged 53 in the Champions One-Day Cup 2024, Pakistan’s List A tournament, and also scored 98 runs in 94 balls against South Africa for Pakistan Shaheens in the ICC Champions Trophy warm-up match. Imam has a solid ODI record, with a healthy average of 48.27, albeit a low strike rate (82.55). The issue for Pakistan now would be their run rate. Imam isn’t an explosive batter like Fakhar and on the other end, you will have Babar, who isn’t exactly a quick scorer either. Mohammad Rizwan (c & wk), Babar Azam, Imam-ul-Haq (for Fakhar Zaman), Kamran Ghulam, Saud Shakeel, Tayyab Tahir, Faheem Ashraf, Khushdil Shah, Salman Ali Agha (vc), Usman Khan, Abrar Ahmed, Haris Rauf, Mohammad Hasnain, Naseem Shah and Shaheen Shah Afridi This website follows the DNPA code of Ethics © Copyright 2025 Insidesport.in

title: TCS collaborates with Salesforce to leverage AI in manufacturing, chip sectors
description: BL Mumbai Bureau Collaboration involves sales initiatives based on data-driven insights, predictive analytics and personalised recommendations, among others
content: -201.86 -21.25 -30.00 + 546.00 + 1,061.00 -201.86 -21.25 -21.25 -30.00 -30.00 + 546.00 Get businessline apps on Connect with us TO ENJOY ADDITIONAL BENEFITS Connect With Us Get BusinessLine apps on By BL Mumbai Bureau Comments READ LATER Tata Consultancy Services is collaborating with Salesforce to help customers in the manufacturing and semiconductor industries drive value from artificial intelligence. As part of this collaboration, TCS said it has launched three initiatives such as semiconductor sales accelerator for increasing sales with data-driven insights, seller for the future for providing near real-time insights, predictive analytics, and personalised recommendations and digital field service to equip technicians on field with real-time information, predictive maintenance insights, and optimised scheduling. One of the key challenges for organisations in their AI adoption journeys is to unlock the true value of their data. For large organisations, data is often stored in unstructured silos, the company said in a release. Recognising the unique challenges and opportunities within the manufacturing and semiconductor industries, this collaboration leverages the combined strengths of both companies to digitally transform how customers in these industries sell and service their products, it added. TCS has over two decades of semiconductor expertise spanning research, architecture, design, manufacturing, assembly, and advanced packaging. title: Fulcrum Digital to scale AI ecosystem to 10,000 AI agents by 2025
description: The announcement comes as the digital transformation company celebrates its 25th anniversary
content: -203.22 -19.75 -19.00 + 548.00 + 1,318.00 -203.22 -19.75 -19.75 -19.00 -19.00 + 548.00 Get businessline apps on Connect with us TO ENJOY ADDITIONAL BENEFITS Connect With Us Get BusinessLine apps on By Anupama Ghosh Comments READ LATER Fulcrum Digital has unveiled plans to scale its AI ecosystem to 10,000 AI agents by the end of 2025 as part of its enterprise AI innovation strategy. The announcement comes as the digital transformation company celebrates its 25th anniversary. According to Rajesh Sinha, Founder and Chairman, the company is focusing on Intelligence Amplification (IA) to enhance human decision-making rather than replacing it. This approach represents what Fulcrum Digital sees as the fourth stage of digital maturity for enterprises. The company’s AI R&D hub in India is developing solutions designed to work alongside human teams. As part of this expansion, Fulcrum Digital plans to double its workforce to 3,000 employees, reinforcing its commitment to AI innovation. At the centre of this initiative is FD RYZE, described as a one-stop enterprise AI solution. The platform offers capabilities including knowledge base integration, multi-modal querying, comprehensive data access, AI-driven insights, and advanced automation. FD RYZE is already being implemented across multiple industries. An FMCG company uses it to digitise handwritten notes, while a food tech company employs the platform to convert natural language into SQL queries. A furniture retailer has connected FD RYZE with its HR SharePoint to provide instant responses to employee queries. Fulcrum Digital emphasises that its AI solutions are industry-agnostic and language model-agnostic, allowing enterprises to integrate AI without overhauling existing systems. The company reports these capabilities are delivering cost savings and operational efficiencies across sectors including financial services, insurance, and retail. Founded in 1999, Fulcrum Digital currently supports over 100 global clients from facilities in the US, Latin America, Europe, and India.
